title: Practice-Based Instructional Design Strategies for MOOC Quality Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience, MOOC participation, or educational platform proficiency
context.additional_context: Focused on strengthening practical MOOC design capabilities that prioritize learners' real-world application, with formative assessments through hands-on tasks utilizing digital device-provided environments.

learning_goals: The ability to analyze learner experiences is cultivated by utilizing a MOOC quality evaluation framework (information quality, service quality, system quality).
A plan is proposed to improve the practicality of MOOC content by over 30% through practice-based task design.
A system is established to derive learning process improvements using formative assessment tools (quizzes, feedback surveys, peer evaluation).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
